radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in size and without focal lesions. The gallbladder is not particularly distended; however, it contains a stone lodged within its neck that does not move with change in position. There is a small stone within the fundus of the gallbladder. No wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid found. The common bile duct is normal measuring 4 mm. Right kidney measures 11 cm; left kidney measures 11.6 cm, with no hydronephrosis or stones. The spleen is normal in size at 10.7 cm. Visualized portions of the pancreas, IVC, and aorta are unremarkable.
